wikipedia_page.main: Charles Albert Watts (27 May 1858 – 15 May 1946) was an English secularist editor and publisher.  He founded the journal Watts's Literary Guide, which later became the New Humanist magazine, and the Rationalist Press Association.  His father Charles Watts was also a prominent secularist writer. Father and son are sometimes confused with each other, and Charles Albert Watts is sometimes referred to as C. A. Watts or Charles Watts Jr.
